detaileddescription.para: Indicates if the ethernet transaction queue is busy ingesting a command at this moment,
Return value: bool: true if the queue is ingesting a command and cannot accept a new one at this specific moment

A blocking call that waits until the value of a local L1 memory address on the Tensix core executing this function becomes equal to a target value. This L1 memory address is used as a semaphore of size 4 Bytes, as a synchronization mechanism. Also, see noc_semaphore_set.

entry.para: Semaphore address in local L1 memory
The target value of the semaphore

detaileddescription.para: A blocking call that waits until the value of a local L1 memory address on the Tensix core executing this function becomes equal to or greater than a target value. This L1 memory address is used as a semaphore of size 4 Bytes, as a synchronization mechanism. Also, see noc_semaphore_set.

entry.para: Semaphore address in local L1 memory
The target value of the semaphore

detaileddescription.para: This blocking call waits for all the outstanding enqueued noc_async_read calls issued on the current Tensix core to complete. After returning from this call the noc_async_read queue will be empty for the current Tensix core.

This blocking call waits for all the outstanding enqueued noc_async_write calls issued on the current Tensix core to complete. After returning from this call the noc_async_write queue will be empty for the current Tensix core.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint32_t src_addr, uint32_t dst_addr, uint32_t num_bytes, uint32_t num_bytes_per_send=16, uint32_t num_bytes_per_send_word_size=1)
memberdef.name: eth_send_bytes

detaileddescription.para: Initiates an asynchronous write from a source address in L1 memory on the local ethernet core to L1 of the connected remote ethernet core. Also, see eth_wait_for_receiver_done and eth_wait_for_bytes.

entry.para: Source address in local eth core L1 memory
Destination address in remote eth core L1 memory
Size of data transfer in bytes, must be multiple of 16

memberdef.argsstring: (uint32_t src_addr, uint32_t dst_addr, uint32_t num_bytes, uint32_t num_bytes_per_send=16, uint32_t num_bytes_per_send_word_size=1)
memberdef.name: eth_send_bytes_over_channel_payload_only

detaileddescription.para: Initiates an asynchronous write from a source address in L1 memory on the local ethernet core to L1 of the connected remote ethernet core. However, this is only the first half of the sender's part of then transaction. It does not include the sending of the write completion signature to the receiver.

entry.para: Source address in local eth core L1 memory
Destination address in remote eth core L1 memory
Size of data transfer in bytes, must be multiple of 16
Which transaction channel to use. Corresponds to
Number of bytes to send per packet

memberdef.argsstring: (uint32_t src_addr, uint32_t dst_addr, uint32_t num_bytes, uint32_t channel, uint32_t num_bytes_per_send=16, uint32_t num_bytes_per_send_word_size=1)
memberdef.name: eth_send_bytes_over_channel

detaileddescription.para: Initiates an asynchronous write from the local ethernet core to a register of the connected remote ethernet core.

entry.para: Destination address in remote eth core reg space

detaileddescription.para: A blocking call that waits for receiver to acknowledge that all data sent with eth_send_bytes since the last reset_erisc_info call is no longer being used. Also, see eth_receiver_done().
Caller is expected to be sender side. Indicates to caller that the receiver has received the last payload sent, and that the local sender buffer can be cleared safely
Return value: bool: true if the receiver has acked

entry.para: Which transaction channel to check. Corresponds to

detaileddescription.para: Caller is expected to be sender side. Tells caller that the receiver has both received the last payload sent, and also that it has cleared it to its consumers. If true, indicates that caller (sender) send safely send more data.
Return value: bool: true if the receiver has acked and forwarded the payload.

entry.para: Which transaction channel to check. Corresponds to

detaileddescription.para: Caller is expected to be sender side. This call will block until receiver sends both levels of ack

entry.para: Which transaction channel to block on

detaileddescription.para: Caller is expected to be sender side. This call will block until receiver sends both levels of ack

entry.para: Which transaction channel to block on

detaileddescription.para: A blocking call that waits for num_bytes of data to be sent from the remote sender ethernet core using any number of eth_send_byte. User must ensure that num_bytes is equal to the total number of bytes sent. Example 1: eth_send_bytes(32), eth_wait_for_bytes(32). Example 2: eth_send_bytes(16), eth_send_bytes(32), eth_wait_for_bytes(48).

entry.para: Size of data transfer in bytes, must be multiple of 16

detaileddescription.para: Caller is expected to be receiver side. This call will tell the receiver whether or not there is payload data to in the local buffer
Return value: bool: True if payload data was sent (and not yet cleared) on the channel
Caller is expected to be receiver side. This call block until there is payload data in the local buffer associated with the channel

entry.para: Number of bytes to receive before returning to caller

detaileddescription.para: Initiates an asynchronous call from receiver ethernet core to tell remote sender ethernet core that data sent via eth_send_bytes is no longer being used. Also, see eth_wait_for_receiver_done. Sends over channel 0
Caller is expected to be receiver side. This call sends the second (and first) level ack to sender, indicating that the receiver flushed its buffer and is able to accept more data
Caller is expected to be sender side. This clears the local first level ack field. Useful when resetting on sender side in preparation for next send
Caller is expected to be receiver side. This sends the first level ack to sender, indicating that the last payload sent on the channel was received and that sender is free to clear its buffer

entry.para: Address of 16B memory (also 16B aligned) segment with
to send the eth_channel_sync_t to sender for first level
